text: In the twenty-third year of the reign of Judah’s King Joash son of Ahaziah, Jehu’s son Jehoahaz became king over Israel. He reigned in Samaria for 17 years.
He did evil in the sight of the Lord. He continued in the sinful ways of Jeroboam son of Nebat who had encouraged Israel to sin; he did not repudiate those sins.
The Lord was furious with Israel and handed them over to King Hazael of Syria and to Hazael’s son Ben Hadad for many years.
Jehoahaz asked for the Lord’s mercy, and the Lord responded favorably, for he saw that Israel was oppressed by the king of Syria.
The Lord provided a deliverer for Israel, and they were freed from Syria’s power. The Israelites once more lived in security.

<st data-num="0389" class="">But</st> they did <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="05493" class="">repudiate</st><n id="1" /> the <st data-num="02403" class="">sinful ways</st> of the <st data-num="01004" class="">family</st><n id="2" /> of <st data-num="03379" class="">Jeroboam</st>, <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> <st data-num="02398" class="">encouraged</st> <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> <st data-num="02398" class="">to sin</st>; they <st data-num="01980" class="">continued</st> in those sins.<n id="3" /> There was <st data-num="01571" class="">even</st> an <st data-num="0842" class="">Asherah pole</st><n id="4" /> <st data-num="05975" class="">standing</st> in <st data-num="08111" class="">Samaria</st>.
Jehoahaz had no army left except for 50 horsemen, 10 chariots, and 10,000 foot soldiers. The king of Syria had destroyed his troops and trampled on them as dust.
The rest of the events of Jehoahaz’s reign, including all his accomplishments and successes, are recorded in the scroll called the Annals of the Kings of Israel.
Jehoahaz passed away and was buried in Samaria. His son Jehoash replaced him as king.
In the thirty-seventh year of King Jehoash’s reign over Judah, Jehoahaz’s son Jehoash became king over Israel. He reigned in Samaria for 16 years.
He did evil in the sight of the Lord. He did not repudiate the sinful ways of Jeroboam son of Nebat who encouraged Israel to sin; he continued in those sins.

The <st data-num="03499" class="">rest</st> of the <st data-num="01697" class="">events</st> of <st data-num="03101" class="">Jehoash’s</st><n id="1" /> reign, including <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> his <st data-num="0834 06213">accomplishments</st> and his <st data-num="01369 0834">successful</st> <st data-num="03898" class="">war</st> <st data-num="05973" class="">with</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="0558" class="">Amaziah</st> of <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st>, <st data-num="03808 01992">are</st> <st data-num="03789" class="">recorded</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">in</st> the <st data-num="05612" class="">scroll</st> called the <st data-num="01697 03117">Annals</st> of the <st data-num="04428" class="">Kings</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>.<n id="2" />
Jehoash passed away and Jeroboam succeeded him on the throne. Jehoash was buried in Samaria with the kings of Israel.
Now Elisha had a terminal illness. King Jehoash of Israel went down to visit him. He wept before him and said, “My father, my father! The chariot and horsemen of Israel!”

<st data-num="0477" class="">Elisha</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">told</st> him, “<st data-num="03947" class="">Take</st> a <st data-num="07198" class="">bow</st> and some <st data-num="02671" class="">arrows</st>,” and he <st data-num="03947" class="">did</st> <st data-num="0413 07198 02671">so</st>.<n id="1" />

Then Elisha<n id="1" /> <st data-num="0559" class="">told</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>, “<st data-num="07392 03027 05921">Aim</st> the <st data-num="07198" class="">bow</st>.”<n id="2" /> He <st data-num="07392" class="">did</st> <st data-num="03027" class="">so</st>,<n id="3" /> and <st data-num="0477" class="">Elisha</st> <st data-num="07760" class="">placed</st> his <st data-num="03027" class="">hands</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king’s</st> <st data-num="03027" class="">hands</st>.

Elisha said, “Open the east window,” and he did so. Elisha said, “Shoot!” and he did so. Elisha said, “This arrow symbolizes the victory the Lord will give you over Syria. You will annihilate Syria in Aphek!”

Then Elisha<n id="1" /> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “<st data-num="03947" class="">Take</st> the <st data-num="02678" class="">arrows</st>,” and he <st data-num="03947" class="">did so</st>.<n id="2" /> He <st data-num="0559" class="">told</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>, “<st data-num="05221" class="">Strike</st> the <st data-num="0776" class="">ground</st>!” He <st data-num="05221" class="">struck</st> the ground <st data-num="07969" class="">three</st> <st data-num="06471" class="">times</st> and <st data-num="05975" class="">stopped</st>.
The prophet got angry at him and said, “If you had struck the ground five or six times, you would have annihilated Syria! But now, you will defeat Syria only three times.”
Elisha died and was buried. Moabite raiding parties invaded the land at the beginning of the year.

One day some men were burying a man when they spotted a raiding party. So they threw the dead man into Elisha’s tomb. When the body touched Elisha’s bones, the dead man came to life and stood on his feet.
Now King Hazael of Syria oppressed Israel throughout Jehoahaz’s reign.

But the Lord had mercy on them and felt pity for them. He extended his favor to them because of the promise he had made to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. He has been unwilling to destroy them or remove them from his presence to this very day.

When <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="02371" class="">Hazael</st> of <st data-num="0758" class="">Syria</st> <st data-num="04191" class="">died</st>, his <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> <st data-num="01130" class="">Ben Hadad</st> <st data-num="08478" class="">replaced</st> him as <st data-num="04427" class="">king</st>.
Jehoahaz’s son Jehoash took back from Ben Hadad son of Hazael the cities that he had taken from his father Jehoahaz in war. Jehoash defeated him three times and recovered the Israelite cities.
